The exception bellow happens when I try to open a JAR manifest using the package
explorer.

1 - import junit.org as binary project
2 - try opening META-INF/MANIFEST.MF inside junit.jar

works for me using M5 on Linux GTK

Just to clarify: the error happens when I double click the MANIFEST.MF node (to
open an editor) inside  the junit.jar.

I can always reproduce it with M5, even on a new workspace.
Ok, got it. Can reproduce this for all non-Java files contained in a jar.

This is probably a missing piece in the implementation. Until we have closed the
gap, we should avoid the expection.
